title: Fraction Division
text: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
speech: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
pacedSpeech: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.

title: Reciprocal
speech: The reciprocal of , a over b,  is  b over a .
pacedSpeech: The reciprocal of  , a over b,
is   b over a

title: Reciprocal of the Second Fraction
speech: What is the reciprocal of , fraction, x y, over 6,  ?

title: Multiplying Fractions
text: The next step is to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
speech: The next step is to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
pacedSpeech: The next step is to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.

title: Determining the Sign
text: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.
speech: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.
pacedSpeech: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.

title: Multiplying Fractions
text: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is $$6x$$ and the denominator is $$2xy$$. The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.
speech: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is , 6 x  and the denominator is  2 x y . The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.

. The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.

title: Checking for Common Factors
text: Do $$6x$$ and $$2xy$$ have any common factors?
speech: Do , 6 x  and  2 x y  have any common factors?
pacedSpeech: Do  , 6 x
and   2 x y
have any common factors?

title: Common Factors
text: We will rewrite $$6x$$ and $$2xy$$ as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.
speech: We will rewrite , 6 x  and  2 x y  as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.
pacedSpeech: We will rewrite  , 6 x
and   2 x y
as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.

title: Rewriting the Numerator
text: What is $$6x$$ written as the product of primes and variable(s)?
speech: What is  6 x  written as the product of primes and variable(s)?

title: Rewriting the Denominator
text: What is $$2xy$$ written as the product of primes and variable(s)?
speech: What is  2 x y,  written as the product of primes and variable(s)?

title: Dividing Common Factors
text: We can now divide out the common factor $$2x$$ from both the top and the bottom, which gives us the fraction $$\frac{3}{y}$$.
speech: We can now divide out the common factor , 2 x  from both the top and the bottom, which gives us the fraction  3 over y .
